oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Burn. Grace G. Markham telegram against ratification.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Grace G. Markham, Hartford, Conn., telegram to Harry Burns (sic.) against ratification. #447. August 19, 1920.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Women's suffrage; Politics & government; Telegrams;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "The majority of women in this country do not want woman suffrage. Do not let Tennessee go down in history of the one state that imposed suffrage on the women of the nation. In behalf of sixty thousand women of the Connecticut Association Opposed to Woman Suffrage. Grace G. Markham, President."
